docs.snippet: Brit diplomat O Wright arrives in Uruguay for talks on Jackson kidnapping, confs with Min Peirano
docs.abstract: Brit diplomat O Wright arrives in Uruguay for talks on Jackson kidnapping, confs with Min Peirano

headline.main: Briton Arrives in Uruguay For Talks on Kidnapping

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 15 (Reuters) -- A $24,000 reward for information leading to the release of Ambassador Jackson has been offered by a group of the British diplomat's friends.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 15 (Reuters) -- A $24,000 reward for information leading to the release of Ambassador Jackson has been offered by a group of the British diplomat's friends.
docs.abstract: $24,000 reward for information on kidnapped Amb Jackson offered by his friends; Brit official O Wright confs with Pres Pacheco, US and Brazilian diplomats; expresses confidence Jackson will be freed unharmed

docs.snippet: A letter purporting to be from the Tupamaro urban guerrillas who kidnapped a United States agricultural expert in Uruguay last Aug. 7 demands $1-million for his release.
docs.lead_paragraph: A letter purporting to be from the Tupamaro urban guerrillas who kidnapped a United States agricultural expert in Uruguay last Aug. 7 demands $1-million for his release.
docs.abstract: Purported Tupamaro lr recd by NY Times demands $1-million ransom for Amer Dr Fly and Brazilian consul A Gomide; lr illus; son J Fly, in telephone int, scores Uruguayan and US Govts nonnegotiation policy, implies that original demand to pub manifesto in news media was small price to pay; doubts family can raise $1-million; Mrs Gomide collapses in Rio after unsuccessful effort to raise funds

headline.main: Letter From Uruguay Asks $1-Million For Release of Abducted U.S. Expert

docs.snippet: Uruguayan newspaper says Govt has asked Interpol to obtain purported Tupamaro lr; Min Francese denial
docs.abstract: Uruguayan newspaper says Govt has asked Interpol to obtain purported Tupamaro lr; Min Francese denial

headline.main: URUGUAY SAID TO ASK FOR NOTE TO TIMES

docs.snippet: US opposes payment of ransom because this may encourage more pol kidnappings and subsequent demands
docs.abstract: US opposes payment of ransom because this may encourage more pol kidnappings and subsequent demands

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO -- Three men -- an American, a Brazilian and an Englishman -- spent last week in strange, improvised prisons somewhere in or near Montevideo. They are being held as hostages in a stalemated contest of political wills between the Tupamaros,...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO -- Three men -- an American, a Brazilian and an Englishman -- spent last week in strange, improvised prisons somewhere in or near Montevideo. They are being held as hostages in a stalemated contest of political wills between the Tupamaros, the urban guerrillas who kidnapped them, and the elected Government of Uruguay.
docs.abstract: Tupamaro war with Uruguayan Govt, kidnappings revd

headline.main: Uruguay: Tupamaros Take Hostages For a Revolution

docs.snippet: The safe return of the kidnapped Swiss Ambassador in Brazil is a cause for relief and rejoicing. Unfortunately, however, Brazil's actions to effect the release of Ambassador Bucher contribute little to resolving the problem of political kidnappings...
docs.lead_paragraph: The safe return of the kidnapped Swiss Ambassador in Brazil is a cause for relief and rejoicing. Unfortunately, however, Brazil's actions to effect the release of Ambassador Bucher contribute little to resolving the problem of political kidnappings in the Americas or anywhere else.
docs.abstract: ed contends Bucher ransom and release have done little to resolve problem of pol kidnappings and that revolutionaries will continually resort to abduction so long as it achieves results

docs.snippet: Pres Pacheco ousts Min Francese, who led unsuccessful search for kidnappers; speculation that action indicates softening of Govt stand on pol abductions
docs.abstract: Pres Pacheco ousts Min Francese, who led unsuccessful search for kidnappers; speculation that action indicates softening of Govt stand on pol abductions

headline.main: Uruguay Minister Ousted; Failed to Find Kidnappers

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 20 -- Uruguay, simultaneously in the throes of an urban guerrilla campaign and a presidential election this year, has taken on the appearance of a laboratory for some of South America's most fashionable current political...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 20 -- Uruguay, simultaneously in the throes of an urban guerrilla campaign and a presidential election this year, has taken on the appearance of a laboratory for some of South America's most fashionable current political ideas.
docs.abstract: comment on pol situation sees Uruguay as 'laboratory' for current revolutionary ideas in Latin Amer; disaffection with traditional pol ways, desperation over econ decline and lack of leadership noted

byline.original: By JOSEPH NOVITSKISpecial to The New York Times
